attributes.action: Keep to Kill A Mockingbird and other classics on the English literature curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
It is reported today (25.5.14) that the John Steinbeck novella Of Mice and Men, and other American classics including Arthur Miller’s play The Crucible and the Harper Lee novel To Kill a Mockingbird, have been dropped from new English literature GCSEs after Michael Gove, the education secretary, insisted teenagers had to study works by British writers. (Source - The Sunday Times)

This is a disgrace.

I call for the Education Secretary to keep these internationally recognised classics on the curriculum.
